title: Growing Together Intimately
description: Explore your vision for how your intimate connection can continue to grow.

questions.text: What I most want for our intimate life going forward is...
choices: Deeper emotional connection through it
Maintained passion and desire
Freedom to explore and grow together
Consistent closeness and safety

therapeutic.rationale: Future intimacy visions reveal priorities. Depth-seekers want emotional growth; passion-maintainers want desire; freedom-seekers want exploration; safety-seekers want security. Shared vision aligns your efforts.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different visions can coexist with awareness. The depth-seeker and passion-maintainer both want good things—find how to pursue both.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared vision provides a north star for your intimate life together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you most want for your intimate life? What would make it even better?

questions.text: I believe the key to maintaining a fulfilling intimate life is...
choices: Never stopping the pursuit of each other
Creating safety for honesty and vulnerability
Balancing routine with intentional novelty
Prioritizing it even when life gets busy

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about sustaining intimacy shape behavior. Pursuers stay actively interested; safety-creators focus on emotional foundation; balancers mix comfort and novelty; prioritizers protect time. All approaches can work.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different beliefs are fine—all four of these contribute to fulfilling intimacy. Discuss what each of you most wants to focus on.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared belief focuses your efforts. You're investing in the same approach.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you believe keeps intimate connection alive? Are you doing those things?

questions.text: An area of our intimate life I'd love for us to grow in is...
choices: Communication and openness
Playfulness and spontaneity
Emotional depth and vulnerability
Physical connection and passion

therapeutic.rationale: Growth area desires reveal where you want development. Communication-growers want more dialogue; playfulness-seekers want more fun; depth-seekers want emotional intimacy; physical-focusers want more passion. Naming growth areas enables movement.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different growth areas can both be pursued. Start with the area that feels most pressing or achievable.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared growth focus aligns your development efforts. You're working on the same thing.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What area of your intimate life do you most want to grow? What would that look like?

questions.text: I see our intimate connection as...
choices: A lifelong journey of discovery together
A source of deep comfort and security
An adventure that keeps evolving
A foundation that supports everything else

therapeutic.rationale: How you see intimacy shapes how you approach it. Journey-seers expect ongoing growth; comfort-seers want stability; adventure-seers want novelty; foundation-seers see it as support. These views color your intimate relationship.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different views can enrich each other. The adventure-seer can help the comfort-seer grow; the comfort-seer can help the adventure-seer feel grounded.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared view of intimacy creates aligned meaning and expectations.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you see your intimate connection? What role does it play in your relationship and life?

questions.text: My hope for us in this area of our relationship is...
choices: That we keep talking and stay connected
That we feel safe to be fully ourselves
That we never stop desiring each other
That we grow closer through every season

therapeutic.rationale: Hopes for intimacy reveal deepest values. Talking-hopers value communication; safety-hopers value acceptance; desire-hopers value passion; closeness-hopers value deepening. Sharing hopes creates shared goals.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these hopes are beautiful and compatible. You can pursue all of them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared hopes align your vision for your intimate future together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your deepest hope for your intimate life together? Have you shared that with your partner?
